data.title: 110 Spanish Dog Names (Girl and Boy) for Your Furry Firulais
data.meta_description: Has your love for the Spanish language inspired you to seek out the best Spanish dog names for your furry best friend? Pick the perfect name!
data.text:
Attention passionate dog owners! Is choosing the perfect Spanish name for your dog difficult for you?

Naming your puppy and furry friend has a special significance. You want to choose a name that encourages responsiveness and catches your dog’s attention. What’s more, you want a name that reflects your dog’s personality and essence.

Pick a unique name from this delightful list of 110 Spanish names for dogs!

In this guide, you’ll find:

Essential vocabulary for dog owners

Dog breeds in Spanish

Female dog names

Male dog names

(Jump directly to the dog names here.)

Essential Spanish Vocabulary for Dog Owners

Having a dog is a highly fulfilling and enjoyable thing to do. Los perros (dogs) are loyal and cuddly animals. They are wonderful companions who offer unconditional love and kindness.

Since much of your life involves your lovable dogs, it makes sense to share about them in conversation while putting your Spanish skills to practice.

Example Sentences in Spanish

Yo tengo dos perros.

I have two dogs.

Mi perro se llama Gustavo.

My dog’s name is Gustavo.

Mi perro es un labrador macho.

My dog is a male labrador.

Mi chihuahua se llama Mía.

My chihuahua ‘s name is Mía.

More Vocabulary: Dog Basics in Spanish

Having a dog requires more than choosing between Spanish names for dogs. It’s an act of commitment and responsibility. You have to take care of a dog and satisfy its needs.

Talk about everything you do with your dog with this breakdown of common vocabulary Spanish words and phrases.

Example Sentences in Spanish

Tengo que lavar la cama del perro.

I have to wash the dog bed.

No tenemos concentrado de perro.

We don’t have dog food.

El nombre de la perra es Lola.

The (female) dog’s name is Lola.

Share everything you love about your treasured dog with this lesson on How to Talk About Your Pet in Spanish.

Spanish Dog Owner Verbs

Example Sentences in Spanish

No puedo viajar, tengo que cuidar al perro.

I can’t travel; I have to take care of the dog.

Andrea le da de comer al perro dos veces al día.

Andres feeds the dog twice a day.

Yo salgo a pasear al perro todas las mañanas.

I walk the dog every morning.

Keep your dog healthy with this Spanish Vocabulary Guide for Going to the Vet.

Popular Dog Breeds in Spanish

Dogs come in all shapes and sizes. There are over 300 recognized dog breeds around the world.

La raza canina (dog breed) defines common standards and physical characteristics of types of dogs. Here are some of the top types of dogs Spanish,

Pomeranian – pomeranio

Los pomeranios are a trendy dog breed for 2022. They’re a small, cute, and fuzzy dog breed with long hair, and pointy ears. Their silky looks require plenty of care and grooming.

German Sheperd – pastor alemán

Los pastores alemanes are highly intelligent working dogs. They are large, agile, and strong. It’s a dog breed that requires plenty of physical activity. German shepherds often work with the police.

Miniature Schnauzer – schnauzer miniatura

Los schnauzer miniatura are a highly popular dog breed. These robust little dogs with a playful and loving attitude are easy to train and friendly.

Labrador Retriever – labrador retriever

Los labradores are the most popular dog breed in America. They are friendly, active, and affectionate dogs. They are large, have a thick coat of hair, and enjoy plenty of time outdoors.

Shih-tzu – shih Tzu

Los shih-tzu are adorable, hairy, small dogs with highly expressive eyes. They are different colors and are highly affectionate. They make excellent lap dogs and company.

Mutts – mestizo, chucho

Los chuchos are dogs that don’t have any defined dog breed. They are sharp, witty, loving, and adorable in any form.

Enhance your dog’s intelligence and instincts with this practical list of 25 Spanish Commands for Your Dog.

Choose From the Best Spanish Names for Dogs

Consider the things that distinguish your dog before choosing their name in Spanish.

Spanish dog names represent the perfect opportunity to show off your creativity and the love for your best animal friend.

Choose the one that fits your doggy from this list of memorable Spanish names for dogs. Discover the top 5 male and female Spanish names for dogs, their meanings, and 100 other memorable options you’ll want to consider.

Top 5 Female Spanish Names for Dogs

1. Moon – Luna

The name Luna means moon in Spanish. It represents the beautiful celestial body and is a top name for dogs who are wonderful and stand out.

2. Nala

Nala is one of those Spanish names for dogs that became popular after a movie. Nala is a main character in the Lion King. It’s for dogs that represent this character’s kindness, good heart, and loyalty.

3. Maya

The dog name Maya means “beloved.” This is for those loving and unconditional dogs who are there no matter what.

4. Kira

The name Kira is common among Spanish dog names. It’s of Persian origin and symbolizes brightness and warmth.

5. Laika

Laika is part of the most popular Spanish names for dogs, particularly for large ones. Laika was the name of the first dog to go to space. She was sent aboard Sputnik 2 by the Russians in 1957.

Dogs are highly intelligent creatures that facilitate many tasks. According to CNN, dogs are even aware of the different languages you speak.

More Popular Female Spanish Names for Dogs

Female Spanish Names for Dogs Part 1

Female Spanish Names for Dogs Part 2

Do you know what Kiara or Luz are saying when they wag their tail? Learn How to Read Your Dog’s Body Language.

Female Spanish Names for Dogs Part 3

Female Spanish Names for Dogs Part 4

Princesa is also a popular Spanish name for cats. If you’re a cat lover, this Ultimate Guide to Your Cat in Spanish is perfect for your language skills.

Female Spanish Names for Dogs Part 5

Top 5 Male Spanish Names for Dogs

1. Simba

Simba is another one of those Spanish names for dogs that comes from The Lion King movie. It’s a name for courageous and loyal pups.

2. Max

Max is a name for active. It represents a large size, making it ideal for those small pups who have a strong presence.

3. Rocko – Rocco

Rocco is a name for playful, large, and active dogs. It means strong like a rock.

4. Luke – Lucas

The name Lucas is among the classic Spanish names for dogs. It’s a name of Latín origin and represents someone wise who shines.

5. Toby

The name Toby is catchy and popular. It’s perfect for playful and jolly dogs. It’s short for Tobías (Tobias). Its popularity in the English language has led many Spanish speakers to adopt it for their loving dogs.

More Popular Male Spanish Names for Dogs

Male Spanish Names for Dogs Part 1

Male Spanish Names for Dogs Part 2

Male Spanish Names for Dogs Part 3

These many unique names are unforgettable. Read what the experts at the American Kennel Club recommend about Choosing Boy Dog Names.

Male Spanish Names for Dogs Part 4

Male Spanish Names for Dogs Part 5

Most of the Spanish names for dogs on this list can turn into shorter and more lovable nicknames. Top off this lesson with this fun list of Cute Pet Names for Your Significant Other in Spanish.

Talk About Your Other Passions in Spanish

The process of choosing among Spanish names for dogs is fun. After reading these memorable options, I’m sure you’ll pick the name that best suits your four-legged pal.

Becoming bilingual enhances your cognitive and decision-making abilities. Making better choices comes easier after you sign up for a free trial class at Homeschool Spanish Academy with our certified teachers from Guatemala.
